rows.arabic: تَبَارَكَ ٱلَّذِى نَزَّلَ ٱلْفُرْقَانَ عَلَىٰ عَبْدِهِۦ لِيَكُونَ لِلْعَـٰلَمِينَ نَذِيرًا
rows.translation: Blessed is He Who hath revealed unto His slave the Criterion (of right and wrong), that he may be a warner to the peoples.
rows.transliteration: tabārakal ladhī nazzalal-furqāna `alā `abdihi liyakūna lil`ālamīna nadhīrā

bismillah.translation: In the name of Allah, the Beneficent, the Merciful.

rows.arabic: ٱلَّذِى لَهُۥ مُلْكُ ٱلسَّمَـٰوَٰتِ وَٱلْأَرْضِ وَلَمْ يَتَّخِذْ وَلَدًا وَلَمْ يَكُن لَّهُۥ شَرِيكٌ فِى ٱلْمُلْكِ وَخَلَقَ كُلَّ شَىْءٍ فَقَدَّرَهُۥ تَقْدِيرًا
rows.translation: He unto Whom belongeth the Sovereignty of the heavens and the earth, He hath chosen no son nor hath He any partner in the Sovereignty. He hath created everything and hath meted out for it a measure.
rows.transliteration: alladhī lahu mulkus samāwāti wal-arḍi walam yattakhidh waladan walam yakun lahu sharīkun fil mulki wakhalaqa kulla shay-in faqaddarahu taqdīrā

rows.arabic: وَٱتَّخَذُوا۟ مِن دُونِهِۦٓ ءَالِهَةً لَّا يَخْلُقُونَ شَيْـًٔا وَهُمْ يُخْلَقُونَ وَلَا يَمْلِكُونَ لِأَنفُسِهِمْ ضَرًّا وَلَا نَفْعًا وَلَا يَمْلِكُونَ مَوْتًا وَلَا حَيَوٰةً وَلَا نُشُورًا
rows.translation: Yet they choose beside Him other gods who create naught but are themselves created, and possess not hurt nor profit for themselves, and possess not death nor life, nor power to raise the dead.
rows.transliteration: wattakhadhū min dūnihi ālihatan lā yakhluqūna shay-an wahum yukhlaqūna walā yamlikūna li-anfusihim ḍarran walā naf`an walā yamlikūna mawtan walā ḥayātan walā nushūrā

rows.arabic: وَقَالَ ٱلَّذِينَ كَفَرُوٓا۟ إِنْ هَـٰذَآ إِلَّآ إِفْكٌ ٱفْتَرَىٰهُ وَأَعَانَهُۥ عَلَيْهِ قَوْمٌ ءَاخَرُونَ ۖ فَقَدْ جَآءُو ظُلْمًا وَزُورًا
rows.translation: Those who disbelieve say: This is naught but a lie that he hath invented, and other folk have helped him with it, so that they have produced a slander and a lie.
rows.transliteration: waqālal ladhīna kafarū in hādhā illā ifkunif-tarāhu wa-a`ānahu `alayhi qawmun ākharūn ۖ faqad jā-ū ẓul-man wazūrā

rows.arabic: وَقَالُوٓا۟ أَسَـٰطِيرُ ٱلْأَوَّلِينَ ٱكْتَتَبَهَا فَهِىَ تُمْلَىٰ عَلَيْهِ بُكْرَةً وَأَصِيلًا
rows.translation: And they say: Fables of the men of old which he hath had written down so that they are dictated to him morn and evening.
rows.transliteration: waqālū asāṭīrul-awwalīnak-tatabahā fahiya tumlā `alayhi bukratan wa-aṣīlā

rows.arabic: قُلْ أَنزَلَهُ ٱلَّذِى يَعْلَمُ ٱلسِّرَّ فِى ٱلسَّمَـٰوَٰتِ وَٱلْأَرْضِ ۚ إِنَّهُۥ كَانَ غَفُورًا رَّحِيمًا
rows.translation: Say (unto them, O Muhammad): He who knoweth the secret of the heavens and the earth hath revealed it. Lo! He ever is Forgiving, Merciful.
rows.transliteration: qul anzalahul ladhī ya`lamus sirra fis samāwāti wal-arḍ ۚ innahu kāna ghafūran raḥīmā

rows.arabic: وَقَالُوا۟ مَالِ هَـٰذَا ٱلرَّسُولِ يَأْكُلُ ٱلطَّعَامَ وَيَمْشِى فِى ٱلْأَسْوَاقِ ۙ لَوْلَآ أُنزِلَ إِلَيْهِ مَلَكٌ فَيَكُونَ مَعَهُۥ نَذِيرًا
rows.translation: And they say: What aileth this messenger (of Allah) that he eateth food and walketh in the markets? Why is not an angel sent down unto him, to be a warner with him.
rows.transliteration: waqālū māli hādhar rasūli ya-kuluṭ ṭa`āma wayamshī fil-aswāqi lawlā unzila ilayhi malakun fayakūna ma`ahu nadhīrā

rows.arabic: أَوْ يُلْقَىٰٓ إِلَيْهِ كَنزٌ أَوْ تَكُونُ لَهُۥ جَنَّةٌ يَأْكُلُ مِنْهَا ۚ وَقَالَ ٱلظَّـٰلِمُونَ إِن تَتَّبِعُونَ إِلَّا رَجُلًا مَّسْحُورًا
rows.translation: Or (why is not) treasure thrown down unto him, or why hath he not a paradise from whence to eat? And the evil-doers say: Ye are but following a man bewitched.
rows.transliteration: aw yulqā ilayhi kanzun aw takūnu lahu jannatun ya-kulu minhā ۚ waqālaẓ ẓālimūna in tattabi`ūna illā rajulan mas-ḥūrā

rows.arabic: ٱنظُرْ كَيْفَ ضَرَبُوا۟ لَكَ ٱلْأَمْثَـٰلَ فَضَلُّوا۟ فَلَا يَسْتَطِيعُونَ سَبِيلًا
rows.translation: See how they coin similitudes for thee, so that they are all astray and cannot find a road!
rows.transliteration: un-ẓur kayfa ḍarabū lakal-amthāla faḍallū falā yastaṭī`ūna sabīlā

rows.arabic: تَبَارَكَ ٱلَّذِىٓ إِن شَآءَ جَعَلَ لَكَ خَيْرًا مِّن ذَٰلِكَ جَنَّـٰتٍ تَجْرِى مِن تَحْتِهَا ٱلْأَنْهَـٰرُ وَيَجْعَل لَّكَ قُصُورًۢا
rows.translation: Blessed is He Who, if He will, will assign thee better than (all) that - Gardens underneath which rivers flow - and will assign thee mansions.
rows.transliteration: tabārakal ladhī in shā-a ja`ala laka khayran min dhālika jannātin tajrī min taḥtihal-anhāru wayaj`al laka quṣūrā

rows.arabic: بَلْ كَذَّبُوا۟ بِٱلسَّاعَةِ ۖ وَأَعْتَدْنَا لِمَن كَذَّبَ بِٱلسَّاعَةِ سَعِيرًا
rows.translation: Nay, but they deny (the coming of) the Hour, and for those who deny (the coming of) the Hour We have prepared a flame.
rows.transliteration: bal kadhhabū bis sā`ah ۖ wa-a`tadnā liman kadhhaba bis sā`ati sa`īrā

rows.arabic: إِذَا رَأَتْهُم مِّن مَّكَانٍۭ بَعِيدٍ سَمِعُوا۟ لَهَا تَغَيُّظًا وَزَفِيرًا
rows.translation: When it seeth them from afar, they hear the crackling and the roar thereof.
rows.transliteration: idhā ra-at-hum min makānin ba`īdin sami`ū lahā taghayyuẓan wazafīrā

rows.arabic: وَإِذَآ أُلْقُوا۟ مِنْهَا مَكَانًا ضَيِّقًا مُّقَرَّنِينَ دَعَوْا۟ هُنَالِكَ ثُبُورًا
rows.translation: And when they are flung into a narrow place thereof, chained together, they pray for destruction there.
rows.transliteration: wa idhā ulqū minhā makānan ḍayyiqan muqarranīna da`aw hunālika thubūrā

rows.arabic: لَّا تَدْعُوا۟ ٱلْيَوْمَ ثُبُورًا وَٰحِدًا وَٱدْعُوا۟ ثُبُورًا كَثِيرًا
rows.translation: Pray not that day for one destruction, but pray for many destructions!
rows.transliteration: lā tad`ul yawma thubūran wāḥidan wad`ū thubūran kathīrā

rows.arabic: قُلْ أَذَٰلِكَ خَيْرٌ أَمْ جَنَّةُ ٱلْخُلْدِ ٱلَّتِى وُعِدَ ٱلْمُتَّقُونَ ۚ كَانَتْ لَهُمْ جَزَآءً وَمَصِيرًا
rows.translation: Say: Is that (doom) better or the Garden of Immortality which is promised unto those who ward off (evil)? It will be their reward and journey's end.
rows.transliteration: qul adhālika khayrun am jannatul khuldil latī wu`idal muttaqūn ۚ kānat lahum jazā-an wa maṣīrā

rows.arabic: لَّهُمْ فِيهَا مَا يَشَآءُونَ خَـٰلِدِينَ ۚ كَانَ عَلَىٰ رَبِّكَ وَعْدًا مَّسْـُٔولًا
rows.translation: Therein abiding, they have all that they desire. It is for thy Lord a promise that must be fulfilled.
rows.transliteration: lahum fīhā mā yashā-ūna khālidīn ۚ kāna `alā rabbika wa`dan mas-ūlā

rows.arabic: وَيَوْمَ يَحْشُرُهُمْ وَمَا يَعْبُدُونَ مِن دُونِ ٱللَّهِ فَيَقُولُ ءَأَنتُمْ أَضْلَلْتُمْ عِبَادِى هَـٰٓؤُلَآءِ أَمْ هُمْ ضَلُّوا۟ ٱلسَّبِيلَ
rows.translation: And on the day when He will assemble them and that which they worship instead of Allah and will say: Was it ye who misled these my slaves or did they (themselves) wander from the way?
rows.transliteration: wayawma yaḥshuruhum wa mā ya`budūna min dūnillāhi fayaqūlu a-antum aḍlaltum `ibādī hā-ulā-i am hum ḍallus sabīl

rows.arabic: قَالُوا۟ سُبْحَـٰنَكَ مَا كَانَ يَنۢبَغِى لَنَآ أَن نَّتَّخِذَ مِن دُونِكَ مِنْ أَوْلِيَآءَ وَلَـٰكِن مَّتَّعْتَهُمْ وَءَابَآءَهُمْ حَتَّىٰ نَسُوا۟ ٱلذِّكْرَ وَكَانُوا۟ قَوْمًۢا بُورًا
rows.translation: They will say: Be Thou Glorified! it was not for us to choose any protecting friends beside thee; but Thou didst give them and their fathers ease till they forgot the warning and became lost folk.
rows.transliteration: qālū subḥānaka mā kāna yanbaghī lanā an nattakhidha min dūnika min awliyā-a walākin matta`tahum wa-ābā-ahum ḥattā nasudh dhikra wakānū qawman būrā

rows.arabic: فَقَدْ كَذَّبُوكُم بِمَا تَقُولُونَ فَمَا تَسْتَطِيعُونَ صَرْفًا وَلَا نَصْرًا ۚ وَمَن يَظْلِم مِّنكُمْ نُذِقْهُ عَذَابًا كَبِيرًا
rows.translation: Thus they will give you the lie regarding what ye say, then ye can neither avert (the doom) nor obtain help. And whoso among you doeth wrong, We shall make him taste great torment.
rows.transliteration: faqad kadhhabūkum bimā taqūlūna famā tastaṭī`ūna ṣarfan walā naṣrā ۚ wa man yaẓlim minkum nudhiqhu `adhāban kabīrā

rows.arabic: وَمَآ أَرْسَلْنَا قَبْلَكَ مِنَ ٱلْمُرْسَلِينَ إِلَّآ إِنَّهُمْ لَيَأْكُلُونَ ٱلطَّعَامَ وَيَمْشُونَ فِى ٱلْأَسْوَاقِ ۗ وَجَعَلْنَا بَعْضَكُمْ لِبَعْضٍ فِتْنَةً أَتَصْبِرُونَ ۗ وَكَانَ رَبُّكَ بَصِيرًا
rows.translation: We never sent before thee any messengers but lo! they verily ate food and walked in the markets. And We have appointed some of you a test for others: Will ye be steadfast? And thy Lord is ever Seer.
rows.transliteration: wa mā arsalnā qablaka minal mursalīna illā innahum laya-kulūnaṭ ṭa`āma wayamshūna fil-aswāq ۗ waja`alnā ba`ḍakum liba`ḍin fitnatan ataṣbirūn ۗ wakāna rabbuka baṣīrā

rows.arabic: وَقَالَ ٱلَّذِينَ لَا يَرْجُونَ لِقَآءَنَا لَوْلَآ أُنزِلَ عَلَيْنَا ٱلْمَلَـٰٓئِكَةُ أَوْ نَرَىٰ رَبَّنَا ۗ لَقَدِ ٱسْتَكْبَرُوا۟ فِىٓ أَنفُسِهِمْ وَعَتَوْ عُتُوًّا كَبِيرًا
rows.translation: And those who look not for a meeting with Us say: Why are angels not sent down unto us and (Why) do we not see our Lord! Assuredly they think too highly of themselves and are scornful with great pride.
rows.transliteration: waqālal ladhīna lā yarjūna liqā-anā lawlā unzila `alaynal malā-ikatu aw narā rabbanā ۗ laqadis-takbarū fī anfusihim wa`ataw `utuwwan kabīrā

rows.arabic: يَوْمَ يَرَوْنَ ٱلْمَلَـٰٓئِكَةَ لَا بُشْرَىٰ يَوْمَئِذٍ لِّلْمُجْرِمِينَ وَيَقُولُونَ حِجْرًا مَّحْجُورًا
rows.translation: On the day when they behold the angels, on that day there will be no good tidings for the guilty; and they will cry: A forbidding ban!
rows.transliteration: yawma yarawnal malā-ikata lā bushrā yawma-idhin lil-mujrimīna wayaqūlūna ḥijran maḥjūrā

rows.arabic: وَقَدِمْنَآ إِلَىٰ مَا عَمِلُوا۟ مِنْ عَمَلٍ فَجَعَلْنَـٰهُ هَبَآءً مَّنثُورًا
rows.translation: And We shall turn unto the work they did and make it scattered motes.
rows.transliteration: waqadimnā ilā mā `amilū min `amalin faja`alnāhu habā-an manthūrā

rows.arabic: أَصْحَـٰبُ ٱلْجَنَّةِ يَوْمَئِذٍ خَيْرٌ مُّسْتَقَرًّا وَأَحْسَنُ مَقِيلًا
rows.translation: Those who have earned the Garden on that day will be better in their home and happier in their place of noonday rest;
rows.transliteration: aṣ-ḥābul jannati yawma-idhin khayrun mustaqarran wa-aḥsanu maqīlā

rows.arabic: وَيَوْمَ تَشَقَّقُ ٱلسَّمَآءُ بِٱلْغَمَـٰمِ وَنُزِّلَ ٱلْمَلَـٰٓئِكَةُ تَنزِيلًا
rows.translation: A day when the heaven with the clouds will be rent asunder and the angels will be sent down, a grand descent.
rows.transliteration: wayawma tashaqqaqus samā-u bil ghamāmi wanuzzilal-malā-ikatu tanzīlā

rows.arabic: ٱلْمُلْكُ يَوْمَئِذٍ ٱلْحَقُّ لِلرَّحْمَـٰنِ ۚ وَكَانَ يَوْمًا عَلَى ٱلْكَـٰفِرِينَ عَسِيرًا
rows.translation: The Sovereignty on that day will be the True (Sovereignty) belonging to the Beneficent One, and it will be a hard day for disbelievers.
rows.transliteration: al-mulku yawma-idhinil-ḥaqqu lirraḥmān ۚ wakāna yawman `alal-kāfirīna `asīrā

rows.arabic: وَيَوْمَ يَعَضُّ ٱلظَّالِمُ عَلَىٰ يَدَيْهِ يَقُولُ يَـٰلَيْتَنِى ٱتَّخَذْتُ مَعَ ٱلرَّسُولِ سَبِيلًا
rows.translation: On the day when the wrong-doer gnaweth his hands, he will say: Ah, would that I had chosen a way together with the messenger (of Allah)!
rows.transliteration: wayawma ya`aḍḍuẓ ẓālimu `alā yadayhi yaqūlu yālaytanit-takhadhtu ma`ar rasūli sabīlā

rows.arabic: يَـٰوَيْلَتَىٰ لَيْتَنِى لَمْ أَتَّخِذْ فُلَانًا خَلِيلًا
rows.translation: Alas for me! Ah, would that I had never taken such an one for friend!
rows.transliteration: yāwaylatā laytanī lam attakhidh fulānan khalīlā

rows.arabic: لَّقَدْ أَضَلَّنِى عَنِ ٱلذِّكْرِ بَعْدَ إِذْ جَآءَنِى ۗ وَكَانَ ٱلشَّيْطَـٰنُ لِلْإِنسَـٰنِ خَذُولًا
rows.translation: He verily led me astray from the Reminder after it had reached me. Satan was ever man's deserter in the hour of need.
rows.transliteration: laqad aḍallanī `anidh dhikri ba`da idh jā-anī ۗ wakānash shayṭānu lilinsāni khadhūlā

rows.arabic: وَقَالَ ٱلرَّسُولُ يَـٰرَبِّ إِنَّ قَوْمِى ٱتَّخَذُوا۟ هَـٰذَا ٱلْقُرْءَانَ مَهْجُورًا
rows.translation: And the messenger saith: O my Lord! Lo! mine own folk make this Qur'an of no account.
rows.transliteration: waqālar rasūlu yārabbi inna qawmit-takhadhū hādhal qur-āna mahjūrā

rows.arabic: وَكَذَٰلِكَ جَعَلْنَا لِكُلِّ نَبِىٍّ عَدُوًّا مِّنَ ٱلْمُجْرِمِينَ ۗ وَكَفَىٰ بِرَبِّكَ هَادِيًا وَنَصِيرًا
rows.translation: Even so have We appointed unto every prophet an opponent from among the guilty; but Allah sufficeth for a Guide and Helper.
rows.transliteration: wakadhālika ja`alnā likulli nabiyyin `aduwwan minal mujrimīn ۗ wakafā birabbika hādiyan wanaṣīrā

rows.arabic: وَقَالَ ٱلَّذِينَ كَفَرُوا۟ لَوْلَا نُزِّلَ عَلَيْهِ ٱلْقُرْءَانُ جُمْلَةً وَٰحِدَةً ۚ كَذَٰلِكَ لِنُثَبِّتَ بِهِۦ فُؤَادَكَ ۖ وَرَتَّلْنَـٰهُ تَرْتِيلًا
rows.translation: And those who disbelieve say: Why is the Qur'an not revealed unto him all at once? (It is revealed) thus that We may strengthen thy heart therewith; and We have arranged it in right order.
rows.transliteration: waqālal ladhīna kafarū lawlā nuzzila `alayhil qur-ānu jumlatan wāḥidah ۚ kadhālika linuthabbita bihi fu-ādak ۖ warattalnāhu tartīlā

rows.arabic: وَلَا يَأْتُونَكَ بِمَثَلٍ إِلَّا جِئْنَـٰكَ بِٱلْحَقِّ وَأَحْسَنَ تَفْسِيرًا
rows.translation: And they bring thee no similitude but We bring thee the Truth (as against it), and better (than their similitude) as argument.
rows.transliteration: walā ya-tūnaka bimathalin illā ji-nāka bil ḥaqqi wa-aḥsana tafsīrā

rows.arabic: ٱلَّذِينَ يُحْشَرُونَ عَلَىٰ وُجُوهِهِمْ إِلَىٰ جَهَنَّمَ أُو۟لَـٰٓئِكَ شَرٌّ مَّكَانًا وَأَضَلُّ سَبِيلًا
rows.translation: Those who will be gathered on their faces unto hell: such are worse in plight and further from the right road.
rows.transliteration: alladhīna yuḥsharūna `alā wujūhihim ilā jahannama ulā-ika sharrun makānan wa-aḍallu sabīlā

rows.arabic: وَلَقَدْ ءَاتَيْنَا مُوسَى ٱلْكِتَـٰبَ وَجَعَلْنَا مَعَهُۥٓ أَخَاهُ هَـٰرُونَ وَزِيرًا
rows.translation: We verily gave Moses the Scripture and placed with him his brother Aaron as henchman.
rows.transliteration: walaqad ātaynā mūsal kitāba waja`alnā ma`ahu akhāhu hārūna wazīrā

rows.arabic: فَقُلْنَا ٱذْهَبَآ إِلَى ٱلْقَوْمِ ٱلَّذِينَ كَذَّبُوا۟ بِـَٔايَـٰتِنَا فَدَمَّرْنَـٰهُمْ تَدْمِيرًا
rows.translation: Then We said: Go together unto the folk who have denied Our revelations. Then We destroyed them, a complete destruction.
rows.transliteration: faqulnadh-habā ilal-qawmil ladhīna kadhhabū bi-āyātinā fadammarnāhum tadmīrā

rows.arabic: وَقَوْمَ نُوحٍ لَّمَّا كَذَّبُوا۟ ٱلرُّسُلَ أَغْرَقْنَـٰهُمْ وَجَعَلْنَـٰهُمْ لِلنَّاسِ ءَايَةً ۖ وَأَعْتَدْنَا لِلظَّـٰلِمِينَ عَذَابًا أَلِيمًا
rows.translation: And Noah's folk, when they denied the messengers, We drowned them and made of them a portent for mankind. We have prepared a painful doom for evil-doers.
rows.transliteration: waqawma nūḥin lammā kadhhabur rusula aghraqnāhum waja`alnāhum linnāsi āyah ۖ wa-a`tadnā liẓẓālimīna `adhāban alīmā

rows.arabic: وَعَادًا وَثَمُودَا۟ وَأَصْحَـٰبَ ٱلرَّسِّ وَقُرُونًۢا بَيْنَ ذَٰلِكَ كَثِيرًا
rows.translation: And (the tribes of) A'ad and Thamud, and the dwellers in Ar-Rass, and many generations in between.
rows.transliteration: wa`ādan wathamūda wa-aṣ-ḥābar rassi waqurūnan bayna dhālika kathīrā

rows.arabic: وَكُلًّا ضَرَبْنَا لَهُ ٱلْأَمْثَـٰلَ ۖ وَكُلًّا تَبَّرْنَا تَتْبِيرًا
rows.translation: Each (of them) We warned by examples, and each (of them) We brought to utter ruin.
rows.transliteration: wakullan ḍarabnā lahul-amthāl ۖ wakullan tabbarnā tatbīrā

rows.arabic: وَلَقَدْ أَتَوْا۟ عَلَى ٱلْقَرْيَةِ ٱلَّتِىٓ أُمْطِرَتْ مَطَرَ ٱلسَّوْءِ ۚ أَفَلَمْ يَكُونُوا۟ يَرَوْنَهَا ۚ بَلْ كَانُوا۟ لَا يَرْجُونَ نُشُورًا
rows.translation: And indeed they have passed by the township whereon was rained the fatal rain. Can it be that they have not seen it? Nay, but they hope for no resurrection.
rows.transliteration: walaqad ataw `alal-qaryatil latī umṭirat maṭaras saw-i ۚ afalam yakūnū yarawnahā ۚ bal kānū lā yarjūna nushūrā

rows.arabic: وَإِذَا رَأَوْكَ إِن يَتَّخِذُونَكَ إِلَّا هُزُوًا أَهَـٰذَا ٱلَّذِى بَعَثَ ٱللَّهُ رَسُولًا
rows.translation: And when they see thee (O Muhammad) they treat thee only as a jest (saying): Is this he whom Allah sendeth as a messenger?
rows.transliteration: wa idhā ra-awka in yattakhidhūnaka illā huzuwan ahādhal ladhī ba`athallāhu rasūlā

rows.arabic: إِن كَادَ لَيُضِلُّنَا عَنْ ءَالِهَتِنَا لَوْلَآ أَن صَبَرْنَا عَلَيْهَا ۚ وَسَوْفَ يَعْلَمُونَ حِينَ يَرَوْنَ ٱلْعَذَابَ مَنْ أَضَلُّ سَبِيلًا
rows.translation: He would have led us far away from our gods if we had not been staunch to them. They will know, when they behold the doom, who is more astray as to the road.
rows.transliteration: in kāda layuḍillunā `an ālihatinā lawlā an ṣabarnā `alayhā ۚ wasawfa ya`lamūna ḥīna yarawnal `adhāba man aḍallu sabīlā

rows.arabic: أَرَءَيْتَ مَنِ ٱتَّخَذَ إِلَـٰهَهُۥ هَوَىٰهُ أَفَأَنتَ تَكُونُ عَلَيْهِ وَكِيلًا
rows.translation: Hast thou seen him who chooseth for his god his own lust? Wouldst thou then be guardian over him?
rows.transliteration: ara ayta manit-takhadha ilāhahu hawāhu afa-anta takūnu `alayhi wakīlā

rows.arabic: أَمْ تَحْسَبُ أَنَّ أَكْثَرَهُمْ يَسْمَعُونَ أَوْ يَعْقِلُونَ ۚ إِنْ هُمْ إِلَّا كَٱلْأَنْعَـٰمِ ۖ بَلْ هُمْ أَضَلُّ سَبِيلًا
rows.translation: Or deemest thou that most of them hear or understand? They are but as the cattle - nay, but they are farther astray?
rows.transliteration: am taḥsabu anna aktharahum yasma`ūna aw ya`qilūn ۚ in hum illā kal-an`ām ۖ bal hum aḍallu sabīlā

rows.arabic: أَلَمْ تَرَ إِلَىٰ رَبِّكَ كَيْفَ مَدَّ ٱلظِّلَّ وَلَوْ شَآءَ لَجَعَلَهُۥ سَاكِنًا ثُمَّ جَعَلْنَا ٱلشَّمْسَ عَلَيْهِ دَلِيلًا
rows.translation: Hast thou not seen how thy Lord hath spread the shade - And if He willed He could have made it still - then We have made the sun its pilot;
rows.transliteration: alam tara ilā rabbika kayfa maddaẓ ẓilla walaw shā-a laja`alahu sākinan thumma ja`alnash shamsa `alayhi dalīlā

rows.arabic: ثُمَّ قَبَضْنَـٰهُ إِلَيْنَا قَبْضًا يَسِيرًا
rows.translation: Then We withdraw it unto Us, a gradual withdrawal?
rows.transliteration: thumma qabaḍnāhu ilaynā qabḍan yasīrā

rows.arabic: وَهُوَ ٱلَّذِى جَعَلَ لَكُمُ ٱلَّيْلَ لِبَاسًا وَٱلنَّوْمَ سُبَاتًا وَجَعَلَ ٱلنَّهَارَ نُشُورًا
rows.translation: And He it is Who maketh night a covering for you, and sleep repose, and maketh day a resurrection.
rows.transliteration: wahuwal ladhī ja`ala lakumul layla libāsan wan nawma subātan waja`alan nahāra nushūrā

rows.arabic: وَهُوَ ٱلَّذِىٓ أَرْسَلَ ٱلرِّيَـٰحَ بُشْرًۢا بَيْنَ يَدَىْ رَحْمَتِهِۦ ۚ وَأَنزَلْنَا مِنَ ٱلسَّمَآءِ مَآءً طَهُورًا
rows.translation: And He it is Who sendeth the winds, glad tidings heralding His mercy, and We send down purifying water from the sky,
rows.transliteration: wahuwal ladhī arsalar riyāḥa bushran bayna yaday raḥmatih ۚ wa-anzalnā minas samā-i mā-an ṭahūrā

rows.arabic: لِّنُحْـِۧىَ بِهِۦ بَلْدَةً مَّيْتًا وَنُسْقِيَهُۥ مِمَّا خَلَقْنَآ أَنْعَـٰمًا وَأَنَاسِىَّ كَثِيرًا
rows.translation: That We may give life thereby to a dead land, and We give many beasts and men that We have created to drink thereof.
rows.transliteration: linuḥ-yiya bihi baldatan maytan wanusqiyahu mimmā khalaqnā an`āman wa-anāsiyya kathīrā

rows.arabic: وَلَقَدْ صَرَّفْنَـٰهُ بَيْنَهُمْ لِيَذَّكَّرُوا۟ فَأَبَىٰٓ أَكْثَرُ ٱلنَّاسِ إِلَّا كُفُورًا
rows.translation: And verily We have repeated it among them that they may remember, but most of mankind begrudge aught save ingratitude.
rows.transliteration: walaqad ṣarrafnāhu baynahum liyadhhakkarū fa-abā aktharun nāsi illā kufūrā

rows.arabic: وَلَوْ شِئْنَا لَبَعَثْنَا فِى كُلِّ قَرْيَةٍ نَّذِيرًا
rows.translation: If We willed, We could raise up a warner in every village.
rows.transliteration: walaw shi-nā laba`athnā fī kulli qaryatin nadhīrā

rows.arabic: فَلَا تُطِعِ ٱلْكَـٰفِرِينَ وَجَـٰهِدْهُم بِهِۦ جِهَادًا كَبِيرًا
rows.translation: So obey not the disbelievers, but strive against them herewith with a great endeavour.
rows.transliteration: falā tuṭi`il kāfirīna wajāhid-hum bihi jihādan kabīrā

rows.arabic: وَهُوَ ٱلَّذِى مَرَجَ ٱلْبَحْرَيْنِ هَـٰذَا عَذْبٌ فُرَاتٌ وَهَـٰذَا مِلْحٌ أُجَاجٌ وَجَعَلَ بَيْنَهُمَا بَرْزَخًا وَحِجْرًا مَّحْجُورًا
rows.translation: And He it is Who hath given independence to the two seas (though they meet); one palatable, sweet, and the other saltish, bitter; and hath set a bar and a forbidding ban between them.
rows.transliteration: wahuwal ladhī marajal baḥrayni hādhā `adhbun furātun wahādhā milḥun ujājun waja`ala baynahumā barzakhan waḥijran maḥjūrā

rows.arabic: وَهُوَ ٱلَّذِى خَلَقَ مِنَ ٱلْمَآءِ بَشَرًا فَجَعَلَهُۥ نَسَبًا وَصِهْرًا ۗ وَكَانَ رَبُّكَ قَدِيرًا
rows.translation: And He it is Who hath created man from water, and hath appointed for him kindred by blood and kindred by marriage; for thy Lord is ever Powerful.
rows.transliteration: wahuwal ladhī khalaqa minal mā-i basharan faja`alahu nasaban waṣihrā ۗ wakāna rabbuka qadīrā

rows.arabic: وَيَعْبُدُونَ مِن دُونِ ٱللَّهِ مَا لَا يَنفَعُهُمْ وَلَا يَضُرُّهُمْ ۗ وَكَانَ ٱلْكَافِرُ عَلَىٰ رَبِّهِۦ ظَهِيرًا
rows.translation: Yet they worship instead of Allah that which can neither benefit them nor hurt them. The disbeliever was ever a partisan against his Lord.
rows.transliteration: waya`budūna min dūnillāhi mā lā yanfa`uhum walā yaḍurruhum ۗ wakānal kāfiru `alā rabbihi ẓahīrā

rows.arabic: وَمَآ أَرْسَلْنَـٰكَ إِلَّا مُبَشِّرًا وَنَذِيرًا
rows.translation: And We have sent thee (O Muhammad) only as a bearer of good tidings and a warner.
rows.transliteration: wa mā arsalnāka illā mubashhiran wanadhīrā

rows.arabic: قُلْ مَآ أَسْـَٔلُكُمْ عَلَيْهِ مِنْ أَجْرٍ إِلَّا مَن شَآءَ أَن يَتَّخِذَ إِلَىٰ رَبِّهِۦ سَبِيلًا
rows.translation: Say: I ask of you no reward for this, save that whoso will may choose a way unto his Lord.
rows.transliteration: qul mā as-alukum `alayhi min ajrin illā man shā-a an yattakhidha ilā rabbihi sabīlā

rows.arabic: وَتَوَكَّلْ عَلَى ٱلْحَىِّ ٱلَّذِى لَا يَمُوتُ وَسَبِّحْ بِحَمْدِهِۦ ۚ وَكَفَىٰ بِهِۦ بِذُنُوبِ عِبَادِهِۦ خَبِيرًا
rows.translation: And trust thou in the Living One Who dieth not, and hymn His praise. He sufficeth as the Knower of His bondmen's sins,
rows.transliteration: watawakkal `alal-ḥayyil ladhī lā yamūtu wasabbiḥ biḥamdih ۚ wakafā bihi bidhunūbi `ibādihi khabīrā

rows.arabic: ٱلَّذِى خَلَقَ ٱلسَّمَـٰوَٰتِ وَٱلْأَرْضَ وَمَا بَيْنَهُمَا فِى سِتَّةِ أَيَّامٍ ثُمَّ ٱسْتَوَىٰ عَلَى ٱلْعَرْشِ ۚ ٱلرَّحْمَـٰنُ فَسْـَٔلْ بِهِۦ خَبِيرًا
rows.translation: Who created the heavens and the earth and all that is between them in six Days, then He mounted the Throne. The Beneficent! Ask anyone informed concerning Him!
rows.transliteration: alladhī khalaqas samāwāti wal-arḍa wa mā baynahumā fī sittati ayyāmin thummas-tawā `alal-`arsh ۚ ar-raḥmānu fas-al bihi khabīrā

rows.arabic: وَإِذَا قِيلَ لَهُمُ ٱسْجُدُوا۟ لِلرَّحْمَـٰنِ قَالُوا۟ وَمَا ٱلرَّحْمَـٰنُ أَنَسْجُدُ لِمَا تَأْمُرُنَا وَزَادَهُمْ نُفُورًا ۩
rows.translation: And when it is said unto them: Prostrate to the Beneficent! they say: And what is the Beneficent? Are we to prostrate to whatever thou (Muhammad) biddest us? And it increaseth aversion in them.
rows.transliteration: wa idhā qīla lahumus sjudū lirraḥmāni qālū wa mar raḥmānu anasjudu limā ta-murunā wazādahum nufūrā ۩

rows.arabic: تَبَارَكَ ٱلَّذِى جَعَلَ فِى ٱلسَّمَآءِ بُرُوجًا وَجَعَلَ فِيهَا سِرَٰجًا وَقَمَرًا مُّنِيرًا
rows.translation: Blessed be He Who hath placed in the heaven mansions of the stars, and hath placed therein a great lamp and a moon giving light!
rows.transliteration: tabārakal ladhī ja`ala fis samā-i burūjan waja`ala fīhā sirājan waqamaran munīrā

rows.arabic: وَهُوَ ٱلَّذِى جَعَلَ ٱلَّيْلَ وَٱلنَّهَارَ خِلْفَةً لِّمَنْ أَرَادَ أَن يَذَّكَّرَ أَوْ أَرَادَ شُكُورًا
rows.translation: And He it is Who hath appointed night and day in succession, for him who desireth to remember, or desireth thankfulness.
rows.transliteration: wahuwal ladhī ja`alal layla wan nahāra khilfatan liman arāda an yadhhakkara aw arāda shukūrā

rows.arabic: وَعِبَادُ ٱلرَّحْمَـٰنِ ٱلَّذِينَ يَمْشُونَ عَلَى ٱلْأَرْضِ هَوْنًا وَإِذَا خَاطَبَهُمُ ٱلْجَـٰهِلُونَ قَالُوا۟ سَلَـٰمًا
rows.translation: The (faithful) slaves of the Beneficent are they who walk upon the earth modestly, and when the foolish ones address them answer: Peace;
rows.transliteration: wa`ibādur raḥmānil ladhīna yamshūna `alal-arḍi hawnan wa idhā khāṭabahumul jāhilūna qālū salāmā

rows.arabic: وَٱلَّذِينَ يَبِيتُونَ لِرَبِّهِمْ سُجَّدًا وَقِيَـٰمًا
rows.translation: And who spend the night before their Lord, prostrate and standing,
rows.transliteration: wal ladhīna yabītūna lirabbihim sujjadan waqiyāmā

rows.arabic: وَٱلَّذِينَ يَقُولُونَ رَبَّنَا ٱصْرِفْ عَنَّا عَذَابَ جَهَنَّمَ ۖ إِنَّ عَذَابَهَا كَانَ غَرَامًا
rows.translation: And who say: Our Lord! Avert from us the doom of hell; lo! the doom thereof is anguish;
rows.transliteration: wal ladhīna yaqūlūna rabbanaṣ-rif `annā `adhāba jahannam ۖ inna `adhābahā kāna gharāmā

rows.arabic: إِنَّهَا سَآءَتْ مُسْتَقَرًّا وَمُقَامًا
rows.translation: Lo! it is wretched as abode and station;
rows.transliteration: innahā sā-at mustaqarran wa muqāmā

rows.arabic: وَٱلَّذِينَ إِذَآ أَنفَقُوا۟ لَمْ يُسْرِفُوا۟ وَلَمْ يَقْتُرُوا۟ وَكَانَ بَيْنَ ذَٰلِكَ قَوَامًا
rows.translation: And those who, when they spend, are neither prodigal nor grudging; and there is ever a firm station between the two;
rows.transliteration: wal ladhīna idhā anfaqū lam yusrifū walam yaqturū wakāna bayna dhālika qawāmā

rows.arabic: وَٱلَّذِينَ لَا يَدْعُونَ مَعَ ٱللَّهِ إِلَـٰهًا ءَاخَرَ وَلَا يَقْتُلُونَ ٱلنَّفْسَ ٱلَّتِى حَرَّمَ ٱللَّهُ إِلَّا بِٱلْحَقِّ وَلَا يَزْنُونَ ۚ وَمَن يَفْعَلْ ذَٰلِكَ يَلْقَ أَثَامًا
rows.translation: And those who cry not unto any other god along with Allah, nor take the life which Allah hath forbidden save in (course of) justice, nor commit adultery - and whoso doeth this shall pay the penalty;
rows.transliteration: wal ladhīna lā yad`ūna ma`allāhi ilāhan ākhara walā yaqtulūnan nafsal latī ḥarramallāhu illā bil ḥaqqi walā yaznūn ۚ wa man yaf`al dhālika yalqa athāmā

rows.arabic: يُضَـٰعَفْ لَهُ ٱلْعَذَابُ يَوْمَ ٱلْقِيَـٰمَةِ وَيَخْلُدْ فِيهِۦ مُهَانًا
rows.translation: The doom will be doubled for him on the Day of Resurrection, and he will abide therein disdained for ever;
rows.transliteration: yuḍā`af lahul `adhābu yawmal qiyāmati wayakhlud fīhi muhānā

rows.arabic: إِلَّا مَن تَابَ وَءَامَنَ وَعَمِلَ عَمَلًا صَـٰلِحًا فَأُو۟لَـٰٓئِكَ يُبَدِّلُ ٱللَّهُ سَيِّـَٔاتِهِمْ حَسَنَـٰتٍ ۗ وَكَانَ ٱللَّهُ غَفُورًا رَّحِيمًا
rows.translation: Save him who repenteth and believeth and doth righteous work; as for such, Allah will change their evil deeds to good deeds. Allah is ever Forgiving, Merciful.
rows.transliteration: illā man tāba wa-āmana wa`amila `amalan ṣāliḥan fa-ulā-ika yubaddilullāhu sayyi-ātihim ḥasanāt ۗ wakānallāhu ghafūran raḥīmā

rows.arabic: وَمَن تَابَ وَعَمِلَ صَـٰلِحًا فَإِنَّهُۥ يَتُوبُ إِلَى ٱللَّهِ مَتَابًا
rows.translation: And whosoever repenteth and doeth good, he verily repenteth toward Allah with true repentance -
rows.transliteration: wa man tāba wa`amila ṣāliḥan fa-innahu yatūbu ilallāhi matābā

rows.arabic: وَٱلَّذِينَ لَا يَشْهَدُونَ ٱلزُّورَ وَإِذَا مَرُّوا۟ بِٱللَّغْوِ مَرُّوا۟ كِرَامًا
rows.translation: And those who will not witness vanity, but when they pass near senseless play, pass by with dignity.
rows.transliteration: wal ladhīna lā yash-hadūnaz zūra wa idhā marrū billaghwi marrū kirāmā

rows.arabic: وَٱلَّذِينَ إِذَا ذُكِّرُوا۟ بِـَٔايَـٰتِ رَبِّهِمْ لَمْ يَخِرُّوا۟ عَلَيْهَا صُمًّا وَعُمْيَانًا
rows.translation: And those who, when they are reminded of the revelations of their Lord, fall not deaf and blind thereat.
rows.transliteration: wal ladhīna idhā dhukkirū bi-āyāti rabbihim lam yakhirrū `alayhā ṣumman wa`umyānā

rows.arabic: وَٱلَّذِينَ يَقُولُونَ رَبَّنَا هَبْ لَنَا مِنْ أَزْوَٰجِنَا وَذُرِّيَّـٰتِنَا قُرَّةَ أَعْيُنٍ وَٱجْعَلْنَا لِلْمُتَّقِينَ إِمَامًا
rows.translation: And who say: Our Lord! Vouchsafe us comfort of our wives and of our offspring, and make us patterns for (all) those who ward off (evil).
rows.transliteration: wal ladhīna yaqūlūna rabbanā hab lanā min azwājinā wadhurriyyātinā qurrata a`yunin waj`alnā lil-muttaqīna imāmā

rows.arabic: أُو۟لَـٰٓئِكَ يُجْزَوْنَ ٱلْغُرْفَةَ بِمَا صَبَرُوا۟ وَيُلَقَّوْنَ فِيهَا تَحِيَّةً وَسَلَـٰمًا
rows.translation: They will be awarded the high place forasmuch as they were steadfast, and they will meet therein with welcome and the ward of peace,
rows.transliteration: ulā-ika yujzawnal ghurfata bimā ṣabarū wayulaqqawna fīhā taḥiyyatan wasalāmā

rows.arabic: خَـٰلِدِينَ فِيهَا ۚ حَسُنَتْ مُسْتَقَرًّا وَمُقَامًا
rows.translation: Abiding there for ever. Happy is it as abode and station!
rows.transliteration: khālidīna fīhā ۚ ḥasunat mustaqarran wa muqāmā

rows.arabic: قُلْ مَا يَعْبَؤُا۟ بِكُمْ رَبِّى لَوْلَا دُعَآؤُكُمْ ۖ فَقَدْ كَذَّبْتُمْ فَسَوْفَ يَكُونُ لِزَامًۢا
rows.translation: Say (O Muhammad, unto the disbelievers): My Lord would not concern Himself with you but for your prayer. But now ye have denied (the Truth), therefor there will be judgment.
rows.transliteration: qul mā ya`ba-u bikum rabbī lawlā du`ā-ukum ۖ faqad kadhhabtum fasawfa yakūnu lizāmā
